about:
I am currently a junior software developer at Microsoft in Seattle, working on the Microsoft Project team. I started my journey in Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology in Atlanta, where I graduated with a Bachelors in Computer Science in December 2015. In pursuing my degree, I’ve concentrated on system architecture and computer networking. 
Additionally, I served as President of GITMAD, the mobile application club on campus. I’ve also completed three software development internships. In2013, I worked at IgnitionOne, a digital marketing firm, on the DevOps team where I configured the Hubot chatbot and helped set up a new continuous integration system using OctopusDeploy. In2014, I worked at Rackspace Hosting on the Openstack Marconi (now Zaqar) project and implementing a RabbitMQ cluster orchestration system. In2015, I was at Microsoft in Seattle on the Project Server team where I was able to work with a huge .NET codebase and SQL Server. Most recently, I worked at an Atlanta based cloud startup, Cirrity, where I worked on their new ASP.NET MVC customer portal. When I’m not working, I enjoy trying my hand at photography, working on my personal music player, trying hard to learn more Chinese and playing jazz on the saxophone.
